intro: Helianthostylis paraensis, commonly known as the Paraensis Sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the family. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in open areas with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and for horticultural purposes.
